com.defano.jmonet.tools.util

Class Geometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.util.Geometry

  • public class Geometry
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class with geometric and trigonometric routines used by various tools.

      Calculates the theta angle (in radians) formed between two lines represented by (origin, p1) and (origin, p2).
      static void center(java.awt.Rectangle rect, java.awt.Rectangle inBounds)
      Changes the location of rect such that it's center is positioned at the same location of the center of inBounds.
      static double getLineAngle(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Returns the angle (in degrees) of the line represented by (x1, y1), (x2, y2).
      static double getLineLength(java.awt.Point p1, java.awt.Point p2)
      Returns the length of the line formed by points p1 and p2
      static java.awt.Polygon getRegularPolygon(java.awt.Point location, int sides, double length, double rotation)
      Draws a regular polygon (a shape) whose center is located at the provided location and containing a given number of sides, length and rotation.
      static java.awt.Point lineAtAngle(java.awt.Point origin, int length, double angle)
      Calculates the second point of a line whose length and angle match the given length and angle.
      static java.awt.Point pointWithinBounds(java.awt.Point p, java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
      Returns a point closest to the given point but which remains inside the provided boundary.

      Returns a rectangle that intersects the two points.

      Given a line represented by points p1 and p2, returns a third point forming a line between it and p1 whose angle is the closest multiple of the value provided by toNearestAngle.
      static java.awt.Rectangle squareAtAnchor(java.awt.Point anchor, java.awt.Point bound)
      Returns a Rectangle whose height and width equal the larger dimension of the rectangle formed by anchor and bound, but which always has a corner at anchor.

      • round

        public static int round(java.lang.Double value,
                        int toNearest)
        Rounds a double value to the nearest provided integer multiple. For example rounding 24.3 to the nearest 10 yields 20.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to round
        toNearest - The nearest integer multiple.
        Returns:
        The nearest integer multiple

      • round

        public static int round(int value,
                        int toNearest)
        Rounds an integer value to the nearest provided integer multiple. For example rounding 24 to the nearest 10 yields 20.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to round
        toNearest - The nearest integer multiple; if 0, no rounding occurs
        Returns:
        The nearest integer multiple

      • getLineAngle

        public static double getLineAngle(int x1,
                                  int y1,
                                  int x2,
                                  int y2)
        Returns the angle (in degrees) of the line represented by (x1, y1), (x2, y2).
        Parameters:
        x1 - First x coordinate
        y1 - First y coordinate
        x2 - Second x coordinate
        y2 - Second y coordinate
        Returns:
        The angle (in degrees) of the line formed by these two points

      • lineAtAngle

        public static java.awt.Point lineAtAngle(java.awt.Point origin,
                                         int length,
                                         double angle)
        Calculates the second point of a line whose length and angle match the given length and angle.
        Parameters:
        origin - Origin/location of the line
        length - Length of the line
        angle - Desired angle (in degrees) of the resulting line
        Returns:
        The second point on the line

      • getLineLength

        public static double getLineLength(java.awt.Point p1,
                                   java.awt.Point p2)
        Returns the length of the line formed by points p1 and p2
        Parameters:
        p1 - First point on line
        p2 - Second point on line
        Returns:
        Length of resulting line

      • snapLineToNearestAngle

        public static java.awt.Point snapLineToNearestAngle(java.awt.Point p1,
                                                    java.awt.Point p2,
                                                    int toNearestAngle)
        Given a line represented by points p1 and p2, returns a third point forming a line between it and p1 whose angle is the closest multiple of the value provided by toNearestAngle.
        Parameters:
        p1 - First point on line
        p2 - Second point on line
        toNearestAngle - Closest multiple of degrees for which result should be produced
        Returns:
        A third point such that the line formed by p1 and this value is a multiple of toNearestAngle

      • angleBetweenTwoPoints

        public static double angleBetweenTwoPoints(java.awt.Point origin,
                                           java.awt.Point p1,
                                           java.awt.Point p2)
        Calculates the theta angle (in radians) formed between two lines represented by (origin, p1) and (origin, p2).
        Parameters:
        origin - The common point of both lines
        p1 - The second point in line (origin, p1)
        p2 - The second point in line (origin, p2)
        Returns:
        The theta angle (in radians) between (origin, p1) and (origin, p2)

      • center

        public static void center(java.awt.Rectangle rect,
                          java.awt.Rectangle inBounds)
        Changes the location of rect such that it's center is positioned at the same location of the center of inBounds.
        Parameters:
        rect - The rectangle whose position should be translated
        inBounds - The reference/boundary rectangle that rect should be centered within

      • squareAtAnchor

        public static java.awt.Rectangle squareAtAnchor(java.awt.Point anchor,
                                                java.awt.Point bound)
        Returns a Rectangle whose height and width equal the larger dimension of the rectangle formed by anchor and bound, but which always has a corner at anchor. (Which corner, of course, depends on the location of bound in coordinate space relative to anchor.)
        Parameters:
        anchor - Either top-left, top-right, bottom-left or bottom-right of the square
        bound - The bound used to determine the max dimension of the square
        Returns:
        A Rectangle with equal heights and widths

      • rectangleFromPoints

        public static java.awt.Rectangle rectangleFromPoints(java.awt.Point p1,
                                                     java.awt.Point p2)
        Returns a rectangle that intersects the two points. No order is implied; p1 may be to the top-left or to the bottom-right of p2.
        Parameters:
        p1 - Either top-left, top-right, bottom-left or bottom-right of the rectangle
        p2 - The corner opposite p1
        Returns:
        A rectangle interesting p1 and p2

      • pointWithinBounds

        public static java.awt.Point pointWithinBounds(java.awt.Point p,
                                               java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
        Returns a point closest to the given point but which remains inside the provided boundary.
        Parameters:
        p - The point to test
        bounds - The boundary in which to limit the resultant point
        Returns:
        The value of p if p is within bounds, or the closest point to p that remains inside bounds

      • getRegularPolygon

        public static java.awt.Polygon getRegularPolygon(java.awt.Point location,
                                                 int sides,
                                                 double length,
                                                 double rotation)
        Draws a regular polygon (a shape) whose center is located at the provided location and containing a given number of sides, length and rotation.
        Parameters:
        location - Desired centerpoint of the polygon
        sides - The number of sides to be drawn
        length - The longest dimension of the polygon
        rotation - The angle of the polygon (in radians)
        Returns:
        The specified polygon
